description: Presumably a blend of roll +â€Ž frolic; appeared 1811 as rollicking, 1826 as rollick.

verbs.description: rollick (third-person singular simple present rollicks, present participle rollicking, simple past and past participle rollicked)

entries.meaning: To behave in a playful or carefree manner; to frolic or romp.
(Euphemism for bollock; also spelled rollock) To reprimand.
